title: Bering Land Bridge National Preserve: Arctic Fox
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Land Mammals     Arctic Fox                Arctic Fox         Photo Credit: mrpolyonymous  The arctic fox travels great distances across its range throughout the year. During the winter, it crosses the sea ice to feed on the remains of seals killed by polar bears. A specialized blood circulation in the fox's paws and a thick fur coat protect it from the cold as it travels. The fox will sometimes completely cross the Bering Strait during these journeys!
